intro: Psoralea luteola, commonly known as the yellow psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Psoralea luteola is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
